[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Field: module_data Vec] [Unbounded Growth] At line 579, module_data is unbounded Vec. Can an attacker cause OOM by registering millions of tiny modules? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Field: global_invariants BTreeMap] [Invariant Accumulation] At line 583, global_invariants has no size limit. Can an attacker register millions of invariants to exhaust memory? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Field: exp_info BTreeMap] [Node Info Accumulation] At line 577, exp_info grows unbounded. Can an attacker create modules with millions of expressions to exhaust memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: type_abilities()] [Ability Inference] At line 1563, abilities are inferred using AbilityInferer. Can an attacker craft types with circular dependencies that cause infinite recursion in ability inference? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: is_wellknown_event_handle_type()] [Type Matching] At lines 1549-1559, EventHandle type is detected by module and struct name. Can an attacker create fake EventHandle types to bypass event handling logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: is_pragma_true()] [Pragma Precedence] At line 4755, pragmas are checked at function then module level. Can an attacker exploit precedence to override security-critical module-level settings with function-level pragmas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_num_pragma()] [Numeric Pragma Validation] At line 4780, numeric pragmas are returned without range validation. Can an attacker set extreme pragma values to cause integer overflow in pragma consumers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_ident_pragma()] [Pragma Symbol Injection] At lines 4793-4806, identifier pragmas are retrieved as symbols. Can an attacker inject malicious symbols through pragmas to redirect function calls? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_friend_env()] [Friend Resolution] At line 4968, friend function is resolved via pragma. Can an attacker exploit missing validation to create friend relationships to non-existent functions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_transitive_friend()] [Friend Transitivity] At lines 4971-4979, transitive friends are resolved recursively. Can an attacker create circular friend chains causing infinite recursion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: is_exposed()] [Exposure Detection] At lines 4902-4910, function exposure is determined by visibility and entry status. Can an attacker exploit edge cases where private entry functions are incorrectly considered exposed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: has_unknown_callers()] [Caller Analysis] At lines 4913-4920, functions determine if they have unknown callers. Can an attacker exploit this to bypass optimization passes that assume limited callers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: has_package_visibility()] [Package Visibility] At line 4935, package visibility is stored as a separate flag. Can an attacker exploit inconsistency between has_package_visibility and actual visibility enum to bypass access checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: is_inline()] [Inline Detection] At line 4885, inline status is checked via kind field. Can an attacker mark functions inline to bypass certain verification checks that skip inline functions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_used_functions_with_transitive_inline()] [Transitive Inline Explosion] At lines 5273-5292, transitive inline functions are collected. Can deeply nested inline calls cause exponential explosion in the collected set? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_variants()] [Variant Ordering] At lines 3979-3986, variants are sorted by order field. Can an attacker manipulate variant order to cause field offset confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_field_by_offset_optional_variant()] [Variant Field Access] At lines 4084-4095, variant field lookup iterates all fields. Can an attacker exploit O(n) complexity with thousands of fields to cause DoS? (Low)
